intro: Rutidosis auricoma, commonly known as the golden bell heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, contributing to its hardy nature. Rutidosis auricoma is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
